name: Weatherization Assistance Program - PRAB
info: The Puerto Rican Action Board's Weatherization Assistance Program reduces energy costs for low-income households by increasing the energy efficiency of their homes, while ensuring health and safety.

name: Tobacco Dependence Clinic
info: The Tobacco Dependence Program (TDP) is dedicated to reducing the harm to health caused by tobacco use. The TDP particularly aims to provide expertise on quitting smoking through education, treatment, research, and advocacy.

name: The Life Center-Cancer Risk Assessment and Genetic Counseling Program
info: The LPGA pros In the Fight to Eradicate breast cancer (LIFE) Center at the Cancer Institute of New Jersey is dedicated to teaching young women how to maintain breast health, reduce the factors that increase their risk of breast cancer and test for determining level of risk for breast cancer.

name: The Children's Hospital at Saint Peter's University Hospital
info: The Children’s Hospital at Saint Peter’s University Hospital offers a full-range of pediatric specialized healthcare services for newborns and children through young adulthood.

name: The Cancer Institute of New Jersey
info: The Rutgers Cancer Institute of New Jersey is dedicated to improving the prevention, detection, treatment, and care of patients with cancer, through the transformation of laboratory discoveries into clinical practice. The Cancer Institute of New Jersey delivers advanced comprehensive care to adults and children.
categories: All Categories;Feel Well::Adults;Feel Well::Children & Youth;Feel Well::Seniors

name: Information on Health Insurance Options (on and off)
info: Through  I.O.H.I.O. people with questions about Medicare, Charity Care and New Jersey FamilyCare can talk to staff and trained volunteers who will help them.

name: Baby Equipment Lovingly Loaned
info: The Baby Formula and Emergency Diapers (BFED) program distributes one week’s worth of diapers, wipes, and/or formula for each young child in families referred to them.

name: Health Equipment Loan
info: Through H.E.L.P. people can borrow a variety of medical equipment like shower seats and walkers.

name: Intensive Outpatient Program
info: The Center for Great Expectations Outpatient Services, located at the Clinic of St. Peter’s University Hospital in New Brunswick, NJ, is a community-based outpatient program addressing the ongoing needs of women recovering from substance use disorders.

name: Central Jersey Legal Services, Inc.
info: Central Jersey Legal Services is a nonprofit law firm that offers free legal help in civil (non-criminal) cases for low-income residents of Mercer, Middlesex and Union Counties.

name: Choices, Inc.
info: CHOICES is an exciting new consumer-driven program for smokers with mental illness in New Jersey.

name: Council on Compulsive Gambling of New Jersey, Inc.
info: This is the closest Gamblers Anonymous meeting, on Rutgers's Cook Campus Thursday 7:00-8:30 pm.

name: Bag Meal Lunch Program
info: The Elijah's Promise Bag Lunch Program provides a meal “to go” for people who are working or unable to make it to meal times.
categories: All Categories;Eat Well::Children & Youth;Eat Well::Adults;Eat Well::Seniors

name: Community Soup Kitchen - Elijah's Promise
info: Elijah's Promise Community Soup Kitchen serves an average of 300 free meals every day to those in need. They serve meals Monday through Friday from 11am to 7pm and Saturdays and Sundays from 1pm to 4pm.
categories: All Categories;Eat Well::Children & Youth;Eat Well::Adults;Eat Well::Seniors

name: Promise Jobs Culinary
info: Highly skilled professional staff instruct on a wide variety of culinary fundamentals such as knife skills, cooking methods, catering, and much more. The Baking and Pastry Arts program gives a thorough education on the fundamentals of baking and pastry, including breads, cake preparation, plated desserts as well as alternative diet options such as vegan, dairy-free and diabetic friendly desserts and more.

name: George St Co-op, Inc.
info: The George Street Co-op is a non-profit natural foods store owned and run by its members.  We sell vegetarian foods with the greatest nutritional value possible, and only minimal processing or additives.
categories: All Categories;Eat Well::Children & Youth;Eat Well::Adults;Eat Well::Seniors

name: Keep Middlesex Moving, Inc.
info: KMM's mission is to improve mobility, reduce traffic congestion and improve air quality, thereby making Middlesex County a better place to live, work and do business. We work with our members - your fellow businesses, municipalities and developers - to create transportation solutions and support alternatives such as carpooling, vanpooling, mass transit, compressed work week, telecommuting and much more.

name: Reduced Fee Lawyer Referral Program
info: The purpose of the Reduced Fee Program (RFP) is to extend the Middlesex County Bar Association’s Lawyer Referral Service to people who cannot afford to pay attorneys fees at rates which would ordinarily be charged AND who do not qualify for free legal assistance from the Middlesex County Legal Services Corporation or other no cost legal services.

name: Boarding Home and Rooming House Services
info: The Boarding Home and Rooming House Services investigate complaints of abuse, neglect and exploitation of residents of boarding homes, residential health care facilities, rooming houses and unlicensed facilities, as well as providing outreach services.

name: Middlesex County Safe Housing Program
info: Home maintenance services are provided for Middlesex homeowners ages 60 and over. Their goal is to provide safe, healthy, and secure homes to those that can't perform the tasks on their own.

name: Senior Meal Program of Middlesex County
info: Senior Meal Program is available to Middlesex County Seniors aged 60 and older. The program has a varied menu of tasty entrees and also offer a daily vegetarian menu and accommodate specialized diet for diabetics.

name: Aging information and Assistance
info: The Information & Assistance staff provides information, assistance, referral and advocacy for seniors, persons with disabilities, their caregivers and the general public needing access to services.

name: Statewide Respite Care Program
info: The Statewide Respite Care Program is designed to provide assistance to families by giving unpaid caregivers a break from the daily responsibility of caring for an elderly or disabled relative or friend.

name: Middlesex County Office on Consumer Affairs
info: The Office of Consumer Affairs is responsible for protecting the interests of thousands of consumers by serving as an advocate for their safety and economic well-being and by promoting legal and ethical standards of professional conduct.

name: Middlesex County Office of Victim-Witness Advocacy
info: The purpose of the Victim Witness Unit is to insure the rights of crime victims by providing direct services to crime victims who come to the attention of the County Criminal Justice System. Services are standardized statewide to include components such as case status notification, court accompaniment, referral for counseling services, and safe waiting areas.

name: Middlesex County Victim Advocacy Center
info: This is a neutral setting to coordinate services and expedite the investigations and prosecution of cases involving adult or child victims. Further, necessary services would be immediately available on-site to address the needs of victims and their families.

name: Middlesex County Department of Housing and Community Development
info: zThe Division of Housing and Community Development administers three housing programs funded by the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD): Section 8 Rental Assistance; Community Development Block Grant (CDBG); and HOME Investment Partnerships.

name: Middlesex County Sheriff's Office
info: The primary duty of the Sheriff is the Security of the County Courthouses and protecting all personnel assigned to these facilities as well as providing  emergency medical aid to any and all personnel who may be in the Criminal or Family Courthouses.

name: New Brunswick City Clerk
info: The New Brunswick City Clerk acts as secretary to the governing body, serves as chief registrant of voters in the municipality, and serves as administrative officer that accepts applications for licenses and permits.

name: New Brunswick Counseling Center
info: The New Brunswick Counseling Center provides outpatient treatment for adults and adolescents with mental health and/or substance use disorders.
categories: All Categories;Feel Well::Adults;Feel Well::Children & Youth;Feel Well::Seniors

name: New Brunswick Free Public Library
info: People who live, work, own property, or attend school in the City of New Brunswick may register for a library card without charge. Members of the library may borrow books, magazines, DVDs, and audio books. They may also use the library's computers, electronic indexes, and meeting rooms.
categories: All Categories;Be Well::Children & Youth;Be Well::Adults;Be Well::Seniors;Be Safe::Home Services

name: New Brunswick Housing and Redevelopment Authority
info: The Housing Authority of the City of New Brunswick (which also operates as The New Brunswick Housing Authority, or The New Brunswick Housing and Redevelopment Authority, and NBHA) is a public body organized and operating according to the laws of the State of New Jersey to manage, build, own, and operate assisted and affordable housing and may act as a redevelopment authority in accordance with State law.

name: Community Garden at Feaster Park - Unity Square
info: Unity Square offers plots of land for citizens to plant their own vegetables. Resources are provided, residents just need to sign up in the spring.
categories: All Categories;Eat Well::Children & Youth;Eat Well::Adults;Eat Well::Seniors

name: Elementary After School Programs
info: The Civic League of Greater New Brunswick conducts an after school program in which students have elements of science, technology, engineering, physical education, and performing and visual arts through project-based learning.

name: Five Loaves Food Pantry
info: The Second Reformed Church New Brunswick  is running a food pantry for the local community. The food pantry is unique in that families get to choose their own food rather than receive a pre-packaged set. Families are given “points” based on the number of members in the family. These points can be redeemed for foods across several categories – proteins, beans, vegetables, fruits, rice, pasta, cereals and miscellaneous items.
categories: All Categories;Eat Well::Children & Youth;Eat Well::Adults;Eat Well::Seniors;Be Well::Children & Youth;Be Well::Adults;Be Well::Seniors

name: Food Pantry - Ebenezer Baptist Church
info: Ebenezer Baptist Church’s food pantry serves anyone in need of emegency food services.
categories: All Categories;Eat Well::Children & Youth;Eat Well::Adults;Eat Well::Seniors

name: Food Pantry - Emanuel Lutheran Church
info: The Emanuel Lutheran pantry serves those in need who may access food once a month.
categories: All Categories;Eat Well::Children & Youth;Eat Well::Adults;Eat Well::Seniors;Be Well::Children & Youth;Be Well::Adults;Be Well::Seniors

name: Food Pantry - Suydam Street Reformed Church
info: Suydam Street Reformed Church provides canned and packaged goods, and bread and pastries are distributed on Sundays. Recipients need identification and can access food once a month.
categories: All Categories;Eat Well::Children & Youth;Eat Well::Adults;Eat Well::Seniors

name: George Street Co-op
info: The George Street Co-op is a non-profit natural foods store owned and run by its members.  We sell vegetarian foods with the greatest nutritional value possible, and only minimal processing or additives.  Everyone is welcome to shop at the Co-op and choose from our excellent selection of fresh organic produce, bulk foods, vitamins & herbs, body care and earth-friendly products, gifts, and more.
categories: All Categories;Eat Well::Children & Youth;Eat Well::Adults;Eat Well::Seniors

name: Health Way
info: Health Way Market offers a wide selection of fruits, vegetables, vitamins, natural medicines and more. They also feature a juice bar, healthy food and snacks.
categories: All Categories;Eat Well::Children & Youth;Eat Well::Adults;Eat Well::Seniors

name: Jersey Assistance for Community Caregiving (JACC)
info: JACC is a State-funded program that provides an array of in-home services to enable an individual, at risk of placement in a nursing facility and who meets income and resource requirements and is not Medicaid eligible, to remain in his or her community home.

name: Latino Crime Watch-Unity Square
info: Unity Square provides a place for community members and a representative from the police department meet once a month. A translator is present, making it easier for community members to express themselves.

name: Meal Ministry - Tabernacle Baptist Church
info: Tabernacle Baptist Church provides emergency food and a cooked meal on the second Monday of each month.
categories: All Categories;Eat Well::Children & Youth;Eat Well::Adults;Eat Well::Seniors

name: Meals on Wheels
info: The purpose of Meals on Wheels is to provide a nutritional hot noonday meal and a cold-boxed meal five days a week for the elderly and homebound in New Brunswick and Highland Park who have no one in the home to provide these services.

name: Middle School Extended Day
info: The Civic League of Greater New Brunswick offers an after school program in which students have elements of science, technology, engineering, physical education, and performing and visual arts along with an academic period during which they can receive help with their homework.

name: Middlesex County Board of Social Services
info: The mission of the Middlesex County Board of Social Services is to administer Federal and State public assistance programs in a competent, compassionate and efficient manner. Our goal is to meet the needs of our clients through the prudent use of public funds.
categories: All Categories;Be Well::Children & Youth;Be Well::Adults;Be Well::Seniors

name: Robert Wood Johnson Fitness & Wellness Center
info: RWJ Fitness & Wellness Center is the region’s most spectacular, professional and comprehensive fitness and wellness center. It is our goal to provide you with the proper environment, education, motivation, and professional instruction to help you achieve your fitness goals.
categories: All Categories;Move Well::Children & Youth;Move Well::Seniors;Move Well::Adults

name: Salvation Army
info: The Salvation Army provides social service assistance (Food, Prescriptions, Utility and Rental)
categories: All Categories;Be Well::Children & Youth;Be Well::Adults;Be Well::Seniors

name: State Health Insurance Assistance Program
info: The State Health Insurance  Program (SHIP) provides free help to New Jersey Medicare beneficiaries who have problems with, or questions about their health insurance.

name: Summer Institutes
info: During the Summer Institutes, students review and discuss national and statewide policies in a project-based curriculum filled with daily academic activities and projects.

name: The Learn to Earn Summer Program
info: The Civic League of Greater New Brunswick conducts a 29-day career-exploratory experience for middle school students.

name: Veganized Foods
info: Enjoy our modern interpretation of vegan cuisine. Our commitment is to provide the public with delicious, healthy food. We use only pure, wholesome ingredients of the highest quality. 100% vegan, 100% natural, 95% organic and made fresh daily. We are community focused, using local, seasonal and fair trade ingredients.
categories: All Categories;Eat Well::Children & Youth;Eat Well::Adults;Eat Well::Seniors

name: Youth Empowerment Services
info: Youth Empowerment Services (YES) is a non-profit organization that helps children become successful, engaged adults through mentoring, tutoring, and social programs. YES’s Oasis summer camp provides breakfast and lunch to its participants, along with opportunities to learn about new foods and healthy eating. During X-Cite Nite, which occurs twice a week, children have nutritious snacks and the opportunity to relax and play in a safe environment. The organization also provides financial literacy classes to parents, where they learn the most cost- effective ways to buy and store food.
categories: All Categories;Move Well::Children & Youth;Eat Well::Children & Youth;Be Well::Children & Youth

name: (BMSCH) Bristol-Myers Squibb Children's Hospital 1st fl Conf. Rm
4-H Youth Development - Rutgers Cooperative
info: 4-H is a community of young people across America who are learning leadership, citizenship, and life skills. The New Jersey 4-H Youth Development Program offers everyone in grades K–13, the opportunity to explore countless opportunities in science, arts, foods, outdoor adventure and more.
categories: All Categories;Move Well::Children & Youth;Eat Well::Children & Youth

name: A Better World Café
info: Better World Cafe is a community kitchen that envisions a world in which all eat healthy sustainable food. The cafe, located in Highland Park, allows consumers to “pay what you can”. Those who can afford to pay a little more for their meal subsidize those who choose the daily complimentary meal. Volunteers, staff, and Promise Culinary School graduates locally procure produce when possible, create tasty and nutritious seasonal menus, and compost food scraps. Proceeds are cycled back to Elijah’s Promise to provide food and resources to those in need.
categories: All Categories;Eat Well::Children & Youth;Eat Well::Adults;Eat Well::Seniors

name: Action Pregnancy Center, Inc.
info: Action Pregnancy Center has compassionate counselors to guide you through the decision process if you think you may be pregnant.
categories: All Categories;Feel Well::Adults;Feel Well::Children & Youth;Feel Well::Seniors

name: Adult Protective Services - Middlesex County
info: The Adult Protective Services (APS) Program exists to serve vulnerable adults, those adults 18 years of age and older who lack sufficient understanding or capacity to make, communicate or carry out decisions concerning their well-being and are subject to abuse, neglect, or exploitation.

name: Alice Jennings Archibald Park
info: Opened in 1998, Alice Jennings Archibald Park is located off Van Dyke Avenue in the City’s 4th Ward and features 10.5 acres of athletic facilities for baseball, softball, soccer, football, tennis, basketball, and handball. Courts and fields are lighted for night time play. This park also includes a playground and picnic pavilion. In 1999 City Engineer Thomas Weingartner was recognized by the New Jersey Association of Municipal Engineers for the outstanding work done to design this park.
categories: All Categories;Move Well::Children & Youth;Move Well::Seniors;Move Well::Adults

name: Anshe Emeth Community Development Corporation (AECDC)
info: Anshe Emeth Community Development Corporation (AECDC) collaborates with service providers and other agencies. AECDC Food Funnel collects donated food for Elijah’s Promise Soup Kitchen and food pantries in Middlesex County and Franklin Township (Anshe Emeth Community Development Corporation).

name: Better World Market
info: Better World Market is a local food market that provides job training and job opportunities, connects farmers with consumers, and directs profits to Elijah’s Promise’s Community Soup Kitchen. A partnership with Suydam farms, Better World Market works with the NJ Farmers Bureau to source and sell local produce. Better World Market’s offerings include local produce, baked goods from the Better World Bakery, and products from small NJ businesses. The Community Soup Kitchen and Promise Culinary School use unsold produce in their programs minimizing waste, providing healthy food to at-risk people, and creating new opportunities. New Jersey Monthly has lauded the market for having the largest selection of Jersey-made food products they’ve seen under one roof (New Jersey Monthly, 2014).
categories: All Categories;Eat Well::Children & Youth;Eat Well::Adults;Eat Well::Seniors

name: Boyd Park
info: This 20 acre award winning park was reopened in 1999 as part of an $11 million redevelopment effort of New Brunswick’s riverfront. Boyd Park offers an alluring view of the Raritan River as well as New Brunswick’s skyline. This park has played host to many festivals and special events including the Raritan River Festival, Hispanic Festival, and the City’s 4th of July Celebration. The park also features a 3/4 long mile tow path with lights as well a historical swing bridge, canal, and locks. Extensive historical signage has been installed to help visitors learn about the rich history of the Raritan River and the City of New Brunswick.
categories: All Categories;Move Well::Children & Youth;Move Well::Seniors;Move Well::Adults

name: Buccleuch Park
info: This park located between the Raritan River and Easton Avenue features 78 acres of rolling terrain. Buccleuch Park (pronounced (Bugle-low), is home to the Buccleuch Mansion, a former Colonial Estate. The mansion recently underwent a historical restoration and is open for tours on Sundays from 2-4 p.m. from June to October.
categories: All Categories;Move Well::Children & Youth;Move Well::Seniors;Move Well::Adults

name: Cancer Education & Community Outreach
info: The Middlesex County Cancer Education and Early Detection (CEED) Program provides comprehensive outreach, education, and screening services for breast, cervical, colorectal and prostate cancers.

name: Cash Assistance Adults (GA)
info: The Cash Assistance Adult Program (GA) provides cash benefits, medical coverage and support services to individuals and couples with no dependent children.

name: Cash Assistance Family/TANF
info: The Cash Assistance Family (TANF) is a public assistance program designed to help families move to self-sufficiency by offering them cash payments, child care services, and transportation assistance among other services.

name: Center for Ambulatory Resources (CARES) - 4TH FL Conf. Rm
info: 4th floor Conference Room

name: Chidren's Specialized Hospital
info: Children’s Specialized Hospital is the nation’s leading provider of inpatient and outpatient care for children from birth to 21 years of age facing special health challenges — from chronic illnesses and complex physical disabilities like brain and spinal cord injuries, to developmental and behavioral issues like autism and mental health. At 13 different New Jersey locations, our pediatric specialists partner with families to make our many innovative therapies and medical treatments more personalized and effective...so children can achieve more of their goals.
categories: All Categories;Be Well::Children & Youth;Feel Well::Children & Youth

name: Children's Immunization Program
info: The Children's Immunization Program is a cooperative effort between the Middlesex County Health Department and the Middlesex County Board of Social Services. The Immunization Program reviews immunization records and provides free immunizations to school age children who are residents of Middlesex County who do not have insurance coverage for shots.

name: Christ Church Episcopal Food Pantry
info:
The Christ Church Episcopal Food Pantry serves anyone in need of emergency food pantries. 

Regular Distribution Schedule:

  • Second and Third Wednesday of the month, 6:00-7:30 p.m.
  • Last two Fridays of the month, 9:00-10:30 a.m.
  • Last two Saturdays of the month, 10:30-12:00 a.m.

Two bags per month per household.
categories: All Categories;Eat Well::Children & Youth;Eat Well::Adults;Eat Well::Seniors

name: Crossroads To Success Program
info: The Crossroads to Success Program is an extended school day, weekend and summer intervention effort to assist New Brunswick male residents 14 to 18 years old who are at the greatest risk of engaging in a myriad of behaviors that jeopardize their productive future.
categories: All Categories;Be Well::Children & Youth;Be Safe::Home Services

name: Damon House Inc.
info: Damon House is a rehabilitation program ( both outpatient & residential) for chemically addicted individuals.

name: Division of Vocational Rehabilitation Services
info: The New Jersey Division of Vocational Rehabilitation Services (DVRS) provides services that enable individuals with disabilities to find jobs or keep their existing jobs.

name: Domestic Violence Liaison
info: Women Aware provides a liaison between their organization and Middlesex County Division of Child Protection and Permanency (DCP&P) offices to provide support and advocacy to their clients who have been victims of domestic violence.

name: Domestic Violence Response Teams
info: Women Aware provides Domestic Violence Response Team volunteers with a minimum of 40 hours of training to assist victims of domestic violence in crisis situations. Volunteers will give support and information with the goal of empowering victims to make informed decisions based on her/his options available.

name: Douglass Outreach
info: Douglass Outreach provides services using the principles of Applied Behavior Analysis to individuals with autism spectrum disorders, their families and the educational programs that support them.

name: Douglass School
info: The Douglass School is a public college-operated program. It offers a full-day, extended school-year and comprehensive services for learners ages 3-21 having a diagnosis of autism spectrum disorder.

name: English as a Second Language
info: English classes for adults are offered by the New Brunswick Public Schools Adult Learning Center.

name: English for Parents of New Brunswick Students
info: English classes for parents living in New Brunswick are offered by the New Brunswick Public Schools Adult Learning Center.

name: Eric B. Chandler Health Center
info: The Eric B. Chandler Health Center is a comprehensive, family-oriented community health center, jointly operated by the Robert Wood Johnson Medical School and Eric B. Chandler Community Board, Inc.
categories: All Categories;Feel Well::Adults;Feel Well::Children & Youth;Feel Well::Seniors

name: Evening School for the Foreign Born
info: Education at night for adults is offered by the New Brunswick Public Schools Adult Learning Center.

name: Every Person Influences Children (EPIC)
info: EPIC provides programs for parents, character education for families and schools, and training for schools and agencies in an effort to help raise children to become responsible adults.

name: Feaster Park
info: The New Brunswick Parks system features 272 beautiful acres of parks, playgrounds, passive areas, athletic fields, facilities, lawns, and gardens. Many of our parks can be reserved for special events by contacting the Administration Department at (732) 745-5007.
categories: All Categories;Move Well::Children & Youth;Move Well::Seniors;Move Well::Adults

name: Memorial Stadium
info: Recognized by the New Jersey Society of Municipal Engineers as the Municipal Project of the year in 2001, this 15-acre park is located adjacent to New Brunswick Middle School and is home to many sporting events for youth and adults. The facility boasts a football/soccer stadium that seats 5,000 people, a practice football/soccer field, baseball field, softball field, tennis courts, locker rooms, and concession stands. In 2014, the City of New Brunswick will fund the replacement of a grass field at Memorial Stadium with a synthetic turf field. This project site will be funded with CDBG money to meet local demand for improved access to recreational facilities.
categories: All Categories;Move Well::Children & Youth;Move Well::Seniors;Move Well::Adults

name: New Jersey Blood Services
info: New Jersey Blood Services is a branch of New York Blood Center, an organization that provides blood products to health organizations and also serves as a blood donor ceter for those wishing to donate blood

name: Shiloh Community Garden
info: Shiloh Community Garden has provided New Brunswick residents with the space and educational resources to grow food since 2010. The program shares the best cost-effective practices for growing in home gardens and increases access to fresh food for low-income residents. For $15, residents lease a raised garden bed for a growing season. Group work days and specialized workshops assist amateur gardeners to ensure their success. Elijah’s Promise staff co-manage the Community Garden Coalition, a working group of the New Brunswick Community Food Alliance, which leads the city’s urban agriculture and community gardening activities. A partnership between Elijah’s Promise and the Rutgers School of Environmental and Biological Sciences led to the creation of a 35 tree apple orchard at the garden in 2013 (Rutgers School of Environmental and Biological Sciences AES Newsroom, 2013).

name: WorkForce 55+
info: WorkForce 55+ is a federally funded program that offers economically disadvantaged seniors, 55 years of age and older, jobs and training. The aim of WorkForce 55+ is to help seniors return to the work place through a program in which you earn while you learn.

name: Work First NJ - AWEP Alternative Work Experience Program
info: The Work First NJ program helps individuals who can't find unsubsidized employment to acquire general skills and training for employment.

name: Women Infant Children (WIC)
info: Women, Infant, and Children (WIC) is a federally funded program that provides assistance for women, infants and children. The WIC program for Middlesex and Monmouth County is under Visiting Nurse Association Health Group, which is a non-profit organization dedicated to the promotion, restoration and maintenance of the health status of individuals and the community. The aim of the WIC program is to help decrease the risk of poor birth outcomes and to improve the health of infants and children during critical times of growth and development, through the distribution of vouchers for supplemental nutritious foods, coupled with access to nutrition education, and appropriate referrals to other health or social services.
categories: All Categories;Eat Well::Children & Youth;Be Well::Children & Youth;Be Well::Adults

name: Women Helping Women
info: WHW is dedicated to providing affordable counseling services to women, young girls and teens struggling with issues related to domestic violence, sexual abuse, divorce, depression, loss, self-esteem, peer pressure, relationships and addiction.
categories: All Categories;Feel Well::Adults;Feel Well::Children & Youth;Feel Well::Seniors

name: Women Aware: PALS Program
info: The PALS (Peace: a Learned Solution) Program at Women Aware offers counseling for children (ages 3-12) and supportive services to families who have been victimized by domestic violence and abuse.

name: Women Aware: Hotline
info: Women Aware provides comprehensive services to victims of domestic violence. Their hotline is available 24 hours a day, 365 days a year for crisis counseling and resource and referral information.

name: Unity Square
info: Unity Square is a community organizing and social justice initiative of Catholic Charities, Diocese of Metuchen that works to empower community members and catalyze change in the poorest residential neighborhood of New Brunswick, NJ. In so doing, Unity Square addresses a diverse set of issues, including economic development, employment, civic participation, crime and safety, immigrants’ rights, and tenants’ rights. Led by community leaders, Unity Square works closely with partner organizations, city officials, and other stakeholders to achieve its goals. Among its accomplishments are New Brunswick’s only bilingual Crime Watch group; the passage a first-of-its-kind city ordinance aimed at preventing wage theft; the hosting of a bilingual candidate forum for the New Brunswick School Board elections; the maintenance of a growing system of community gardens; and education and outreach to over 2,000 residents on tenant rights issues.
categories: All Categories;Be Well::Children & Youth;Be Well::Adults;Be Well::Seniors;Be Safe::Home Services

name: The Stacy Goldstein Breast Cancer Center at The Cancer Institute of New Jersey
info: The Stacy Goldstein Breast Cancer Center provides comprehensive care for people with breast cancer. The Cancer Institute's breast cancer team includes nurse practitioners, medical oncologists, surgical oncologists, radiation oncologists, breast radiologists, plastic and reconstructive surgeons, pathologists, social workers, and clinical psychologists.

name: The Gifted Child Clinic
info: The Gifted Child Clinic serves as a referral agency for children who are thought to be gifted or talented. Children between three and twelve years of age are referred by parents, pediatricians and educators.

name: Tenant's Rights - Unity Square
info: Unity Square offers assistance with issues with landlords and provide basic information about tenant's rights and responsibilities. They also help residents fill out paperwork or file a complaint.

name: Summer Theatre Academy
info: The Summer Theatre Academy is an all-day theatre camp for youth and teens.

name: Special Child Health Services
info: The Middlesex County Special Child Health Services (SCHS) program provides comprehensive Case Management for special needs children from birth to the 22nd birthday, who may have a disease, disorder or condition that may interfere with normal growth or development.

name: Saint Peter's University Hospital
info: Saint Peter's Healthcare System was formed in 2007 and reflects the expansive scope of health and wellness services we offer to our community. Besides Saint Peter's University Hospital, the system includes the Saint Peter's Foundation and the Saint Peter's Health and Management Services Corporation, which oversees various initiatives, including the Margaret McLaughlin McCarrick Care Center, our nursing home in Somerset; the CARES Surgicenter, an ambulatory surgery center adjacent to the hospital in New Brunswick; our Adult Day Center in Monroe; and our Family Health Center in New Brunswick that serves, among others, juvenile victims of sexual abuse, economically disadvantaged families and mentally disabled and/or violence-prone youth. Our services are offered to all. We are a Catholic institution with a capital "C" and a small "c." We draw inspiration from our religious heritage. Our care for others is universal, extending to those of other faiths and in some cases, of no faith whatsoever. Without question, the fact that ours is a faith-based healthcare delivery system is of primary significance. At Saint Peter's Healthcare System, you will find leading-edge technology and an experienced staff. You will also find the trust and compassion that we have always been known for. This is our legacy—our very sacred ministry.
categories: All Categories;Feel Well::Adults;Feel Well::Children & Youth;Feel Well::Seniors

name: Ryan White Program
info: Access point for HIV health and support services
categories: All Categories;Be Well::Children & Youth;Be Well::Adults;Be Well::Seniors

name: RWJ Fitness & Wellness Center - Community Ed. Room
Public Health Clinic
info: The Public Health clinic provides a variety of services including STD/STI screening, evaluation, treatment, follow-up, and referral; HIV counseling and testing; Well Baby Clinic/Immunization Clinic; and Adult Immunization Clinic.
categories: All Categories;Feel Well::Adults;Feel Well::Children & Youth;Feel Well::Seniors

name: Promise Clinic - HIP HOP
info: The Promise Clinic is a community of medical students, volunteer physicians, and community partners dedicated to providing patient-centered, quality primary care services; as well educating and empowering the clients of Elijah’s Promise Soup Kitchen and the uninsured citizens of New Brunswick, NJ to live healthier lives. Promise Clinic also serves as an environment where medical students and other health professionals can engage in the New Brunswick community through service-learning aimed at teaching the importance of continuity of care, teamwork, advocacy, innovation, and leadership.

name: Prevent Child Abuse New Jersey
info: Prevent Child Abuse New Jersey is the state office for both Healthy Families New Jersey (HF-TIP NJ) and Parents as Teachers New Jersey (PAT-NJ). These two home visiting programs are designed to teach new parents how to form healthy bonds with their babies, to interact in developmentally appropriate ways.

name: Pharmaceutical Assistance for the Aged & Disabled
info: The Pharmaceutical Assistance to the Aged & Disabled (PAAD) is a state program for low-income New Jersey residents ages 65 and older or 18 and older that offers prescription assistance.

name: Pediatric Immunization Clinic
info: The Pediatric (Child) Health Program provides preventive health care and education for infants and children in the community and oversees the immunization records of children attending daycare and schools.

name: Parent Infant Care Center
info: The Parent Infant Care Center (PIC-C), a partnership between PRAB, New Brunswick Tomorrow and the New Brunswick Board of Education, provides on-site day care, case management and counseling services for teen mothers attending New Brunswick High School and their child.

name: NJ Youth Corps of Middlesex County
info: The New Jersey Youth Corps of Middlesex County teaches young adults vocational and employment skills.

name: New Jersey Unemployment Insurance Benefit Claim
info: The Department of Labor and Workforce Development provides links to the unemployment insurance online self-service application and answer questions regarding the matter.

name: New Jersey Division of Disability Services
info: The Division of Disability Services (DDS) focuses on serving people who have become disabled as adults, whether through illness or injury. The Division serves as a single point of entry for people with disabilities who need information and/or services within the human services system.
categories: All Categories;Be Well::Children & Youth;Be Well::Adults;Be Well::Seniors

name: New Hope Foundation
info: New Hope Foundation is dedicated to the treatment of adults and adolescents affected with alcohol, drug, and gambling addiction.
categories: All Categories;Feel Well::Adults;Feel Well::Children & Youth;Feel Well::Seniors

name: New Brunswick School Based Youth Services
info: Located at the High School, Middle School and 4 Elementary schools in New Brunswick, Puerto Rican Action Board staff provide individual, group counseling, case management, job placement, and recreation activities.
categories: All Categories;Be Well::Children & Youth;Feel Well::Children & Youth

name: New Brunswick Public Schools Adult Learning Center
info: The New Brunswick Public Schools Adult Learning Center offers services and classes for adults.

name: New Brunswick Hub Teen Center
info: The Hub Teen Recreation Center is a state of the art facility for teens ages 13 to 19. It consists of a batting cage, golf range, game room, movie theater, computer lab, sound studio, fitness center, cafe, multipurpose rooms, and meeting rooms.

name: New Brunswick Health Department
info: In conjunction with the Middlesex County Health Department, The Division of Health provides immunizations, health screening sessions and health education programs throughout New Brunswick.
categories: All Categories;Feel Well::Adults;Feel Well::Children & Youth;Feel Well::Seniors

name: Murphy Park
info: The New Brunswick Parks system features 272 beautiful acres of parks, playgrounds, passive areas, athletic fields, facilities, lawns, and gardens. Many of our parks can be reserved for special events by contacting the Administration Department at (732) 745-5007.
categories: All Categories;Move Well::Children & Youth;Move Well::Seniors;Move Well::Adults

name: Middlesex County Senior Nutrition Services
info: Nutrition programs for Middlesex County senior residents such as: providng Ensure for seniors with dietary issues, vouchers to buy food at local farmer's markets, a senior meal plan, and home delievered meals.

name: Middlesex County Office of Human Services
info: The Office of Human Services is responsible for providing coordination and referrals for social services  for Middlesex County residents.
categories: All Categories;Be Well::Children & Youth;Be Well::Adults;Be Well::Seniors

name: Middlesex County Office of Aging & Disabiltiy Services
info: The Middlesex County Office of Aging & Disabiltiy Services provides assistance for the homebound frail/elderly and disabled adults age 18-64 in  need of services such as prescritpion assistance, home care/ adult day care, home devilvered meals and durable medical supplies/equipment.

name: Middlesex County Multi Assistance Program
info: The Middlesex County Multi Assistance Program, administered by the Middlesex County Office of Aging & Disabled Services, provides assistance for homebound, frail, elderly, and disabled adults ages 18-64 in need of services to help them remain safely in the community.

name: Middlesex County Division of Mental Health and Addiction Services
info: The Division of Mental Health and Addiction Services is the state mental health authority (SMHA) and the Single State Authority on Substance Abuse (SSA) that plans, monitors, evaluates and regulates New Jersey's mental health and substance abuse prevention, early intervention, treatment and recovery efforts.
categories: All Categories;Be Well::Children & Youth;Be Well::Adults;Be Well::Seniors

name: Middlesex County Adult Health
info: The Adult Health Division offers a variety of health education and prevention activities for county residents in collaboration with local agencies for the purpose of chronic disease management and seasonal illness prevention such as blood pressure screening, flu vaccines, and health education and counseling.

name: Medical Assitance Programs
info: The Medical Assitance Programs for Middlesex County residents include:Medicaid, the Assisted Living Program, the Community Carte Program for the Elderly & Disabled, and the AIDS Community Alternative Program

name: Manavi
info: Manavi provides supportive counseling and support groups for South Asian women who are victims of violence.

name: Literacy/Pre-Diploma Basic Skills
info: Literacy classes for adults are offered by the New Brunswick Public Schools Adult Learning Center.

name: Lead Poisoning Prevention & Case Management
info: This program provides a number of services to prevent lead poisoning including screening for children 9 months to 6 years old, case management, environmental interventions, and education.

name: Joyce Kilmer Park
info: The New Brunswick Parks system features 272 beautiful acres of parks, playgrounds, passive areas, athletic fields, facilities, lawns, and gardens. Many of our parks can be reserved for special events by contacting the Administration Department at (732) 745-5007.
categories: All Categories;Move Well::Children & Youth;Move Well::Seniors;Move Well::Adults

name: Hyacinth AIDS Foundation - Wellness Program
info: The Wellness Community at Hyacinth helps people manage the emotional impact of an HIV diagnosis. TWCH helps clients find control, hope, and community again through group discussions.

name: Hyacinth AIDS Foundation - Prevention Services
info: Hyacinth’s  HIV Prevention Services for men, women, and people living with HIV

name: HSE Preparation in Spanish
info: Preparation for the High School Equivalency test (formerly GED) is offered by the New Brunswick Public Schools Adult Learning Center.

name: HSE Preparation
info: Preparation for the High School Equivalency test (formerly GED) is offered by the New Brunswick Public Schools Adult Learning Center.

name: Food Stamps Program
info: The Food Stamp Program is a federally funded program administered by the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) which provides benefits to eligible households in order to increase their food purchasing power and improve the nutritional adequacy of the diets of low-income families.
categories: All Categories;Eat Well::Children & Youth;Eat Well::Adults;Eat Well::Seniors

name: Family Outreach Program
info: The Family Outreach Program provides information about referrals and resources, family coaching, child development awareness, and addresses basic family needs in an effort to close the gap in intellectual levels between urban and suburban kindergarteners.

name: Elijah's Promise
info: Since 1989, Elijah’s Promise has used food as a tool to alleviate hunger, empower lives and invite justice for the most vulnerable members of our Central New Jersey community. We operate a community soup kitchen, culinary arts school, catering business, pay-as-you-can café, and connect low-income individuals and families with social and health services. With the support of volunteers, donors and community partners, we serve more than 100,000 meals per year and train previously unskilled workers for careers in the food service industry.
categories: All Categories;Eat Well::Children & Youth;Eat Well::Adults;Be Well::Adults

name: Catholic Charities, Diocese of Metuchen
info: Catholic Charities, Diocese of Metuchen, uses the principles of quality, creativity, respect and empowerment as the guiding forces behind the agency's mission. When reaching out to those in the community needing service, particular attention is given to the poor, undervalued or disenfranchised. Programs focus on the value of family, individual knowledge and the right of every client to be treated with dignity and respect.
categories: All Categories;Be Well::Children & Youth;Be Well::Adults;Be Well::Seniors

name: New Brunswick Mayor's Office
info: Jim Cahill is the 62nd Mayor of the City of New Brunswick. During his tenure as Mayor, New Brunswick has experienced an unprecedented wave of growth and investment that has transformed this once declining industrial City into a thriving 21st Century Urban Center.

name: New Brunswick Police Department
info: The New Brunswick Police Department is committed to providing a safe and peaceful environment in the City of New Brunswick through effective and impartial law enforcement.

name: New Jersey Employment Services (Work Force NJ)
info: The New Jersey Employment Services help job seekers find jobs and employers find workers. They provide specific programs for veterans, workers ages 55+, ex-offenders, and individuals with disabilities.

name: Planned Parenthood - New Brunswick
info: Planned Parenthood delivers vital reproductive health care, sex education, and information to millions of women, men, and young people worldwide.
categories: All Categories;Be Well::Children & Youth;Be Well::Adults;Be Well::Seniors;Feel Well::Adults;Feel Well::Children & Youth;Feel Well::Seniors

name: Ronald McDonald House - New Brunswick
info:
The Ronald McDonald House of New Brunswick, is located adjacent to the Robert Wood Johnson University campus.

A critical need for the House was identified in 2000, due in part to the continuing expansion of quality pediatric services in this “Healthcare City.” The New Brunswick House serves all hospitals and medical facilities throughout the greater New Brunswick area.The New Brunswick house includes:

  • Six themed bedrooms with private baths and phones with voicemail; the smallest bedroom can accommodate up to three people and the larger rooms up to six
  • A full kitchen with two of each appliance, a well-stocked pantry and a food storage area for each family
  • Laundry facilities with supplies
  • Hygiene items, linens and towels
  • A comfortable living room with new computers
  • A bright, fun playroom with an area for teens
  • An enclosed yard with a playground area and a covered porch for relaxing
  • Free parking on House grounds
  • 24-hour staffing
  • Lots of support from our staff, volunteers and other guests

For special accommodation needs, please call 732-249-1222 before your arrival.

name: St. Peter's Food and Nutrition Services
info: At the Food and Nutrition Services, registered dietitians at Saint Peter's University Hospital offer personal nutrition counseling and diet education for children and adults.
categories: All Categories;Be Well::Children & Youth;Be Well::Adults;Be Well::Seniors

name: St. Peter's Natural Family Planning
info: At The National Gianna Center for Women’s Health and Fertility, fertility specialists use the Creighton Model FertilityCare™ System to monitor a woman’s menstrual and fertility cycle. By learning to identify the signs of a woman’s fertility, a couple can then learn how to use this information to achieve or avoid a pregnancy, depending on their goals.

name: Saint Peter's Community Education
info: Saint Peter’s University Hospital offers the community a variety of free health-related lectures, health education programs and classes, medical screenings, and support groups.
categories: All Categories;Be Well::Children & Youth;Be Well::Adults;Be Well::Seniors;Feel Well::Adults;Feel Well::Children & Youth;Feel Well::Seniors

name: Saint Peter's Community Mobile Health Unit
info: When members of the community can’t get to Saint Peter’s University Hospital for health care, Saint Peter’s takes health care into the community with a 34-foot health van that visits schools, retirement communities, day care centers, homeless shelters, senior centers, public housing complexes, shopping centers, and corporations.
categories: Be Well::Children & Youth;Be Well::Adults;Be Well::Seniors;Feel Well::Adults;Feel Well::Children & Youth;Feel Well::Seniors

name: Saint Peter's Family Health Center
info: The Family Health Center provides primary and preventive health care for children and adults.
categories: All Categories;Feel Well::Adults;Feel Well::Children & Youth;Feel Well::Seniors

name: For Keeps: Children's Acute Partial Hospitalization Program for behavioral health services
info: Saint Peter’s University Hospital's For KEEPS program (Kids Embraced and Empowered through Psychological Services) is a short term acute partial-hospitalization state of the art unit. They offer high quality mental health diagnoses and intensive treatment to children who suffer from emotional and behavioral difficulties.

name: Moving Forward Community Wellness Center
info: The Moving Forward Self-Help Center is a place where adult mental health consumers gather in a safe, supportive and friendly environment designed to empower them to realize a lifestyle centered on wellness and recovery.

name: HIV/AIDS Counseling and Testing
info: The HIV Counseling and Testing Program serves the needs of those persons who may be at risk for the acquisition of infection with the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV).
categories: All Categories;Be Well::Children & Youth;Be Well::Adults;Be Well::Seniors;Feel Well::Adults;Feel Well::Children & Youth;Feel Well::Seniors

name: SIDS Center of New Jersey
address: 1 Robert Wood Johnson Place, MEB Floor 3, #312
info: The Sudden Infant Death Syndrome Center of New Jersey (SCNJ) is a program that works with parents, grandparents, physicians, nurses, the child care community, hospitals, first responders, schools, social service agencies, health and education programs and state, federal and national organizations to reduce infant mortality and the racial and ethnic disparities associated with it.

name: New Brunswick Group Home (YCS)
info: The Sawtelle Home for Children in New Brunswick is a  therapeutic residence for 4 girls under the age of 21 with a dual diagnosis of intellectual/developmental disabilities and behavioral health issues.
categories: All Categories;Be Well::Children & Youth;Feel Well::Children & Youth

name: New Brunswick Animal Control
info: The New Brunswick Division of Animal Control responds to calls in both New Brunswick and North Brunswick, rents traps to New Brunswick residents to remove unwanted animals from private property in a harmless way and provides basic veterinary services to animals without owners.

name: New Brunswick Dial-A-Ride
info: Dial-A-Ride is a free curb-to-curb transportation service provided for elderly (60+), disabled and low income residents of the City of New Brunswick.

name: New Brunswick Vital Statistics Bureau
info: The Office of Vital Statistics and Registry registers vital events and maintains vital records like birth, marriage, death, and adoptions.
categories: All Categories;Be Well::Children & Youth;Be Well::Adults;Be Well::Seniors

name: Retired And Senior Volunteer Program - Salvation Army
info: The Salvation Army of New Brunswick sponsors the Retired Seniors Volunteer Program. The Salvation Army matches the skills, experience and available time of senior volunteers to meet a variety of needs in Middlesex County

name: New Brunswick Youth Services System
info: New Brunswick’s Youth Services System provides comprehensive after-school programming for New Brunswick residents ages 6-15. This program operates at seven schools within New Brunswick, providing the opportunity for children from all parts of New Brunswick to participate at a site close to their home.

name: Play It Smart
info: Play It Smart is a program for academic support for student athletes.

name: Housing Coalition of Central Jersey - PRAB
info: The Housing Coalition of Central Jersey provides a wide range of programs to assist Middlesex County residents with housing services.

name: Home Energy Assistance Program - Middlesex County - PRAB
info: The Low-Income Home Energy Assistance Program (LIHEAP) assists eligible individuals and families to receive a benefit towards lowering their heating bills. This program also offers a cooling assistance benefit towards the use of air conditioning during the summer months for those who have a medical need.

name: PRAB
info: PRAB is a comprehensive Human Services Organization in Middlesex County, New Jersey that provide a comprehensive range of essential services for children, youth, families and senior citizens.
categories: All Categories;Be Well::Children & Youth;Be Well::Adults;Be Well::Seniors

name: Preschool Program - PRAB
info: PRAB offers a free ten (10) month educational program that provides every child, regardless of their socioeconomic status, a comprehensive and exceptional education. Parents must submit income verification in order to qualify for the wraparound and summer program services.

name: Project Connect - PRAB
info: The Puerto Rican Action Board's Project Connect engages at-risk youth in available community programs, thereby reducing anti-social criminal behavior and gang involvement. Both at-risk and court-involved New Brunswick youth are eligible to participate in Project Connect, with the aim of preventing first-time or additional engagement with the juvenile justice system.

name: New Brunswick Department of Social Services
info: The Department of Social Services provides comprehensive social services to the residents of New Brunswick in areas including health, recreation, and vital statistics.
categories: All Categories;Be Well::Children & Youth;Be Well::Adults;Be Well::Seniors

name: The Society of Vincent DePaul Food Pantry
info: The Society of Vincent DePaul Food Pantry provides food for individuals who do not have enough food to eat.
categories: All Categories;Eat Well::Children & Youth;Eat Well::Adults;Eat Well::Seniors

name: New Brunswick Senior Center
info: The New Brunswick Senior Citizen Resource Center (NBSCRC) is a multi-purpose facility for independent seniors and is designed to provide a safe, supportive and stimulating environment.

name: New Brunswick Recreation
info: New Brunswick Recreation is pleased to offer a variety of programs for its residents and visitors in the City of New Brunswick, New Jersey.
categories: All Categories;Move Well::Children & Youth;Move Well::Seniors;Move Well::Adults

name: Soup Kitchen - Ebenezer Baptist Church - Feed My Sheep Ministry
categories: All Categories;Eat Well::Children & Youth;Eat Well::Adults;Eat Well::Seniors

name: Rutgers Gardens Farmers Market
info: Rutgers Gardens Farmers Market offers locally grown and made food such as poultry, meat, cheese, baked goods, pickles, fruit, and vegetables. The Farmers Market, a partnership of the Rutgers School of Environmental and Biological Sciences (SEBS) and the New Jersey Agricultural Experiment Station (NJAES), promotes recycling, conservation, and sustainable farming. The market is open Fridays 11am–5pm, May 2nd through November 28, 2014.
categories: All Categories;Eat Well::Children & Youth;Eat Well::Adults;Eat Well::Seniors

name: Homeless Prevention Rapid Re-Housing
info: Homeless Prevention Rapid Re-Housing (HPRP) is a short-term financial assistance program for individuals and families who are having difficulty maintaining their current utility bill, rental housing and have a court ordered eviction notice or have lost their housing and are currently homeless. Types of Financial Assistance include: Rental Arrears, Short Term Rental Assistance, Security Deposits, and Utility Deposits and Arrears.

name: Robert Wood Johnson University Hospital
info: RWJUH New Brunswick is the flagship Cancer Hospital of Rutgers Cancer Institute of New Jersey and the principal hospital of Rutgers Robert Wood Johnson Medical School in New Brunswick, NJ. Robert Wood Johnson is an innovative leader in advancing state-of-the-art care. Its Centers of Excellence include cardiovascular care from minimally invasive heart surgery to transplantation, cancer care, and women’s and children’s care including The Bristol-Myers Squibb Children’s Hospital at Robert Wood Johnson University Hospital. The hospital is also a Level 1 Trauma Center and serves as a national resource in its ground-breaking approaches to emergency preparedness. The hospital has earned significant national recognition for clinical quality and patient safety. RWJUH has been ranked among the best hospitals in America by U.S. News & World Report six times and has been selected by the publication as a high performing hospital in several specialties. The Bristol-Myers Squibb Children’s Hospital has also ranked among the nation’s Best Children’s Hospitals by U.S. News & World Report for two consecutive years. The American College of Surgeons’ Commission on Cancer has rated RWJUH among the nation’s best comprehensive cancer centers and the hospital’s Comprehensive Stroke Center is certified by the Joint Commission to provide complex stroke care. The Leapfrog Group rated RWJUH as one of the 50 exceptional U.S. hospitals, as published in Consumers Digest magazine, and has given the hospital an “A” grade for safety and quality. Harvard University researchers, in a study commissioned by The Commonwealth Fund, identified RWJUH as one of the top 10 hospitals in the nation for clinical quality. RWJUH is also a four-time recipient of the prestigious Magnet Award for Nursing Excellence. The Institute for Diversity and Health Management, an American Hospital Association (AHA) affiliate, has recognized RWJUH as a “Best in Class” hospital for diversity management and addressing health disparities.
categories: All Categories;Feel Well::Adults;Feel Well::Children & Youth;Feel Well::Seniors

name: Robert Wood Johnson Pediatric AIDS Program
info: This Program is a regional Pediatric HIV Treatment Center supported partially by the New Jersey State Department of Health. It consists of a coordinated team of physicians, nurses, social workers and psychologists who provide a comprehensive case management approach to the patient with HIV infection that extends from the home to the outpatient department, to the hospital and home again. Referrals and services are coordinated with local visiting nursing services, early intervention programs and other community services. The Program participates as a pediatric AIDS clinical trials unit with the National Institutes of Child Health and Human Development, and Allergy and Infectious Diseases. This participation ensures access to the latest investigational treatment, contributing to improved clinical outcomes.

name: New Brunswick Recreation / HUB Teen Center
New Brunswick Community Farmers Market - Albany St.
info: Johnson & Johnson and Rutgers University Cooperative Extension run the New Brunswick Community Farmers Market (NBCFM), a community farmers market that increases access to fresh healthy food and instills healthy eating habits. Nutrition interns and SNAP-Ed educators provide nutrition lessons and food purchasing tips. People who use federal nutrition assistance such as SNAP, WIC checks, and Senior Farmers Market Nutrition Program vouchers can receive an additional 50% more produce through the Market Bucks program. Those who spend $10 receive an extra $5 in Market Bucks, which extends their food budgets and encourages the purchase of fresh produce. The market also operates a community garden in which volunteers and residents plant produce for the community (NBCFM website; Bradshaw, 2013). Open from June-November, Wednesdays 11AM-3PM.
categories: All Categories;Eat Well::Children & Youth;Eat Well::Adults;Eat Well::Seniors

name: New Brunswick Community Farmers Market - Cook Campus
info: Johnson & Johnson and Rutgers University Cooperative Extension run the New Brunswick Community Farmers Market (NBCFM), a community farmers market that increases access to fresh healthy food and instills healthy eating habits. Nutrition interns and SNAP-Ed educators provide nutrition lessons and food purchasing tips. People who use federal nutrition assistance such as SNAP, WIC checks, and Senior Farmers Market Nutrition Program vouchers can receive an additional 50% more produce through the Market Bucks program. Those who spend $10 receive an extra $5 in Market Bucks, which extends their food budgets and encourages the purchase of fresh produce. The market also operates a community garden in which volunteers and residents plant produce for the community (NBCFM website; Bradshaw, 2013). Open from September-November, Thursdays 11AM-3PM.
categories: All Categories;Eat Well::Children & Youth;Eat Well::Adults;Eat Well::Seniors

info: Johnson & Johnson and Rutgers University Cooperative Extension run the New Brunswick Community Farmers Market (NBCFM), a community farmers market that increases access to fresh healthy food and instills healthy eating habits. Nutrition interns and SNAP-Ed educators provide nutrition lessons and food purchasing tips. People who use federal nutrition assistance such as SNAP, WIC checks, and Senior Farmers Market Nutrition Program vouchers can receive an additional 50% more produce through the Market Bucks program. Those who spend $10 receive an extra $5 in Market Bucks, which extends their food budgets and encourages the purchase of fresh produce. The market also operates a community garden in which volunteers and residents plant produce for the community (NBCFM website; Bradshaw, 2013). Open from June-November, Saturdays 10AM-3PM;  Open from June-August, Thursdays 11AM-3PM.
